sen.j: 木津川（きづがわ）は、三重県および京都府を流れる淀川水系の支流で一級河川。
sen.e: The Kizu-gawa River, a tributary of the Yodo-gawa River System flowing through Mie and Kyoto Prefectures, is a class A river.
The Kizu-gawa River, a tributary of the Yodo-gawa River System flowing through Mie and Kyoto Prefectures, is a class A river.
The Kizu-gawa River, a tributary of the Yodo-gawa River system flowing through Mie and Kyoto Prefectures, is a class A river.
sen.cmt: system 小文字で統一しています。

sen.j: 三重県伊賀市で柘植川と服部川を、京都府相楽郡南山城村で名張川を集める。
sen.e: The Tsuge-gawa and Hattori-gawa Rivers flows into the Kizu-gawa River in Iga City, Mie Prefecture, and the Nabari-gawa River does in Minami Yamashiro-mura, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Tsuge-gawa and Hattori-gawa Rivers flows into the Kizu-gawa River in Iga City, Mie Prefecture, where it gathers into the Nabari-gawa River in Minami Yamashiro-mura, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Tsuge-gawa and Hattori-gawa Rivers flow into the Kizu-gawa River in Iga City, Mie Prefecture, where it gathers into the Nabari-gawa River in Minami Yamashiro-mura, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 名張川合流点よりも上流を伊賀川と称することもある。
sen.e: The Kizu-gawa River upstream from the junction with the Nabari-gawa River is sometimes referred to as Iga-gawa River.
The Kizu-gawa River upstream from the Nabari-gawa River junction is sometimes referred to as Iga-gawa River.
The Kizu-gawa River upstream from the Nabari-gawa River junction is sometimes referred to as Iga-gawa River.

sen.j: 青山高原に源を発し三重県伊賀市東部を北流。
sen.e: The Kizu-gawa River originates in the Aoyama-kogen Highlands and flows north through the eastern part of Iga City, Mie Prefecture.
The Kizu-gawa River originates in the Aoyama-kogen Highlands and flows north through the eastern part of Iga City, Mie Prefecture.
The Kizu-gawa River originates in the Aoyama-kogen Highlands and flows north through the eastern part of Iga City, Mie Prefecture.

sen.j: 鈴鹿山脈の油日岳（標高694m）からの柘植川と、布引山地の笠取山（標高845m）からの服部川を伊賀市北部で合わせ、西流に転じる。
sen.e: Joined in the north of Iga City by the Tsuge-gawa River flowing from Mt. Aburahi-dake (694 meters) in the Suzuka-sanmyaku Mountains and the Hattori-gawa River from Mt. Kasatori-yama (845 meters) in the Nunobiki Mountains, the Kizu-gawa River changes its course to the west.

Joined in the north of Iga City by the Tsuge-gawa River flowing from Mt. Aburahi-dake (694 meters) in the Suzuka-sanmyaku Mountains and the Hattori-gawa River from Mt. Kasatori-yama (845 meters) in the Nunobiki Mountains, the Kizu-gawa River changes its course west.

Joined in the north of Iga City by the Tsuge-gawa River flowing from Mt. Aburahi-dake (694 meters) in the Suzuka mountain range and the Hattori-gawa River from Mt. Kasatori (845 meters) in the Nunobiki Mountains, the Kizu-gawa River changes its course west.
sen.cmt: Mt. Kasatori, Suzuka mountain rangeとしました。

sen.j: 京都府に入る辺りから河谷を成し、相楽郡南山城村で高見山地の三峰山（標高1,235m）が水源の名張川を加える。
sen.e: The valley is formed around the border between Mie and Kyoto Prefectures, and the Kizu-gawa River is joined in Minami Yamashiro-mura, Soraku-gun by the Nabari-gawa River originating in Mt. Miune-yama (1235 meters) in the Takami-sanchi Mountains

A valley is formed around the border between Mie and Kyoto Prefectures, and the Kizu-gawa River is joined in Minami Yamashiro-mura, Soraku-gun by the Nabari-gawa River originating in Mt. Miune-yama (1235 meters) in the Takami-sanchi Mountains

A valley is formed around the border between Mie and Kyoto Prefectures, and the Kizu-gawa River is joined in Minami Yamashiro-mura, Soraku-gun by the Nabari-gawa River originating in Mt. Miune (1235 meters) in the Takami-sanchi Mountains.

sen.j: 木津川市に至り、再び北へ向かう。
sen.e: The river turns north at Kizugawa City, again.
The river turns north at Kizugawa City, again.
The river turns north at Kizugawa City, again.

sen.j: 京田辺市東部から徐々に北西へと流れを変え、八幡市西端、京都府・大阪府境付近で北東からの宇治川（淀川水系本流）、北からの桂川 (淀川水系)と合流し、淀川となる。
sen.e: The river gradually changes its course to the northwest in the east of Kyotanabe City, merges with the Uji-gawa River (the main river of the Yodo-gawa River System), flowing from northeast and with the Katsura-gawa River running from north at the western edge of Yawata City around the border between Kyoto and Osaka Prefectures, and changes its name to Yodo-gawa River.

The river gradually changes its course to the northwest in the east of Kyotanabe City, merges with the Uji-gawa River (the main river of the Yodo-gawa River System), flowing from northeast and with the Katsura-gawa River running from north at the western edge of Yawata City around the border between Kyoto and Osaka Prefectures, and changes its name to Yodo-gawa River.

The river gradually changes its course to the northwest in the east of Kyotanabe City, merges with the Uji-gawa River (the main river of the Yodo-gawa River system), flowing from northeast and with the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) running from north at the western edge of Yawata City around the border between Kyoto and Osaka Prefectures, and changes its name to Yodo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: system 小文字で統一しています。

sen.j: 合流点の5kmほど上流には増水すると踏み板が橋脚から外れる「流れ橋」として有名な上津屋橋が架かっている。
sen.e: Popularly known as 'Nagare bashi' (floating bridge), the Kozuya-bashi Bridge, whose bridge timbers are detached from the bridge pier when the water level in the river rises, is spanned at about 5 km upstream from the junction.

Popularly known as 'Nagare bashi' (floating bridge), the Kozuya-bashi Bridge, whose bridge timbers are detached from the bridge pier when the water level in the river rises, is located about 5 km upstream from the junction.

Popularly known as 'Nagare bashi' (floating bridge), the Kozuya-bashi Bridge, whose bridge timbers are detached from the bridge pier when the water level in the river rises, is located about five km upstream from the junction.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 伊賀市から木津川市にかけて、西日本旅客鉄道関西本線と国道163号（伊賀街道）が並行する。
sen.e: The Kansai Main Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the National Route 163 run parallel from Iga City to Kizugawa City.
The Kansai Main Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the National Route 163 run parallel from Iga City to Kizugawa City.
The Kansai Main Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the National Route 163 run parallel from Iga City to Kizugawa City.

sen.j: 木津川市以北の中・下流域では、東岸をJR西日本奈良線と国道24号（奈良街道）が、西岸をJR西日本片町線と近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線とが沿う。
sen.e: Along the middle and lower Kizu-gawa River to the north of Kizugawa City run the Nara Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the National Route 24 on the east side of the river and the Katamachi Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (Kintetsu Railway) on the west side.

Along the middle and lower Kizu-gawa River to the north of Kizugawa City run the Nara Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the National Route 24 on the east side of the river and the Katamachi Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (Kintetsu Railway) on the west side.

Along the middle and lower Kizu-gawa River to the north of Kizugawa City run the Nara Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the National Route 24 on the east side of the river and the Katamachi Line (West Japan Railway Company) and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (Kintetsu Railway) on the west side.

sen.j: 伊賀市（伊賀上野地区）には上野城、伊賀流忍術屋敷、松尾芭蕉ゆかりの俳聖殿など名所が多い。
sen.e: Iga City (Iga-ueno area) is home to many tourist spots such as Ueno-jo Castle, Iga-ryu Ninjutsu Yashiki (Iga School Ninja House), and the Haisei-den, a memorial hall for Basho MATSUO.
Iga City (Iga-ueno area) is home to many tourist spots such as Ueno-jo Castle, Iga-ryu Ninjutsu Yashiki (Iga School Ninja House), and the Haisei-den, a memorial hall for Basho MATSUO.
Iga City (Iga-ueno area) is home to many tourist spots such as Ueno-jo Castle, Iga-ryu Ninjutsu Yashiki (Iga School Ninja House), and the Haisei-den, a memorial hall for Basho MATSUO.

sen.j: また、元弘の乱（1331年）の際に後醍醐天皇の行在所となった笠置寺が笠置町にある。
sen.e: Additionally, Kasagi-cho has the Kasagi-dera Temple, which was designated as the anzaisho (a temporary palace) of Emperor Godaigo during the Genko no Ran (Genko Rebellion) in 1331.
Additionally, Kasagi-cho has the Kasagi-dera Temple, which was designated as the anzaisho (a temporary palace) of Emperor Godaigo during the Genko no Ran (Genko Rebellion) in 1331.
Additionally, Kasagi-cho has the Kasagi-dera Temple, which was designated as the anzaisho (a temporary palace) of Emperor Godaigo during the Genko no Ran (Genko Rebellion) in 1331.

sen.j: 京田辺市周辺を中心として、河川敷にはチャノキ畑が多く存在する。
sen.e: Many tea plant fields are seen along the riverside of the Kizu-gawa River, especially around Kyotanabe City.
Many tea plant fields are seen along the riverside of the Kizu-gawa River, especially around Kyotanabe City.
Many tea plant fields are seen along the riverside of the Kizu-gawa River, especially around Kyotanabe City.
Mie Prefecture: Iga City
Mie Prefecture: Iga City
Mie Prefecture: Iga City

sen.j: 京都府（は右岸のみに位置する自治体）- 相楽郡南山城村、笠置町、和束町、木津川市、相楽郡精華町、京田辺市、綴喜郡井手町、城陽市、八幡市、久世郡久御山町、京都市伏見区
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture: Minami Yamashiro-mura in Soraku-gun, Kasagi-cho, Wazuka-cho [1], Kizugawa City, Seika-cho in Soraku-gun, Kyotanabe City, Ide-cho in Tsuzuki-gun [1], Joyo City [1], Yawata City, Kumiyama-cho in Kuse-gun [1], and Fushimi Ward in Kyoto City [1] (1. these municipalities are located only on the right side of the river.)
sen.cmt: 「（は右岸のみに位置する自治体）」は、ウェブで確認すると「（*は右岸のみに位置する自治体）」と*が抜けているようですので、対応する自治体と共に注を訳出しました。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture: Minami Yamashiro-mura in Soraku-gun, Kasagi-cho, Wazuka-cho [1], Kizugawa City, Seika-cho in Soraku-gun, Kyotanabe City, Ide-cho in Tsuzuki-gun [1], Joyo City [1], Yawata City, Kumiyama-cho in Kuse-gun [1], and Fushimi Ward in Kyoto City [1] (1. these municipalities are located only on the right side of the river.)

Kyoto Prefecture: Minami Yamashiro-mura, Kasagi-cho, Wazuka-cho[1] in Soraku-gun, Kizugawa City, Seika-cho in Soraku-gun, Kyotanabe City, Ide-cho in Tsuzuki-gun [1], Joyo City [1], Yawata City, Kumiyama-cho in Kuse-gun [1], and Fushimi Ward in Kyoto City [1] (1. these municipalities are located only on the right side of the river.)
sen.cmt: 相楽郡の位置を変更しました。

sen.j: 京都木津川マラソン - 毎年2月に京田辺市の草内木津川運動公園を発着地点として、木津川の南岸のサイクリングコースを中心に行われるマラソン大会。
sen.e: Kizu-gawa River Marathon: a marathon starting in the Kusauchi Kizu-gawa River Sports Park in Kyotanabe City, running mainly along the bicycle path on the south side of the river, and finishing in the park, held every February

Kizu-gawa River Marathon: a marathon held every February which starts in the Kusauchi Kizu-gawa River Sports Park in Kyotanabe City, and runs mainly along the bicycle path on the south side of the river, finishing in the park.

Kizu-gawa River Marathon: a marathon held every February which starts in the Kusauchi Kizu-gawa River Sports Park in Kyotanabe City, and runs mainly along the bicycle path on the south side of the river, finishing in the park.
